##I want to work, like at the office!

Micro-signal, Rancaijing

A feature presentation, a daily in depth report, redefines the innovation economy.

Original by ran CAIJING

Author | Zhao Lei, Jin Fan, Yan Lijiao, Ming Kong

Tang Yahua, dawn, Meng Yanna, Su Qi

Editor | Wei Jia

With the epidemic raging and companies still being asked not to return to work until a certain date after the official holiday has been extended by three days, many companies are working online, and office workers are already experiencing a new work week.

Starting today, some enterprises have resumed group work, but more companies still require employees to work from home in order to minimize risks. For most professionals who are accustomed to working in groups, working from home faces many new challenges.

Temptation is everywhere, there are people who don't wake up for their morning meetings, people who don't want to watch the show first or work first, people who just want to jerk off their cat, and people who, despite their self discipline, suffer from their home environment, the noise of children, the doubts of parents, the trivialities of life, all let a person collapse.

How to ensure the efficiency and quality of work in a comfortable environment, how to deal with the interference of family members, pets, daily life and so on, and how to deal with the various attendance reporting regulations implemented by the company to ensure efficiency, everyone has a different approach.

CNNMONEY interviewed 11 professionals to hear their true feelings of working from home, their common voice is: "I want to work, go to the company that! "

The concern of family affects work efficiency

But I can't get mad

Hu Qing, 28, packaging designer for an internet company

I do design work, Service Party A, usually busy work, no time to rest. Last year the end of the body really can not endure, years ago asked for an extra week off, early back home. I thought, take some time to spend with my family, pick up the things I didn't have time to do before, and paint some watercolors. Years ago, I bought a whole set of cutlery. I thought I would go back to Beijing a few days in advance and Cook for myself.

Results affected by the epidemic situation, the starting time was extended indefinitely. We are the 3rd official start, because I still have a part of years ago work is not finished, from the fifth day began to work in the hometown. But working from home is very inefficient.

Although affected by the epidemic, do not let the Spring Festival visit, but because parents and grandparents live together, grandpa a few brothers children or in groups to worship the new year. There are children, a noisy for several hours, do not accompany talking also basic can not work; even if there are no guests, the home is also basic not quiet down, my father and grandfather like to play chess each other, soon quarreled; GRANDPA likes to read out the news item by item, and watch TV shows like talking to himself; I can't put on my headphones, and grandma comes in every few minutes with a snack, and she makes sure the water in my glass is always full and warm; and my mom, every day before cooking will ask me again, what to eat today. It's love, and you're not mad, and I can't explain the nature of my job.

After staying at home for half a month, I felt that I had reached the limit. Against Their wishes, I returned to Beijing early. When I got back to Beijing, I found that eating had become a problem. At home, you eat with your mouth open, and when you come back, you have to do everything yourself because you can't order in. Before going back to Beijing, my mother worried that I would not make pasta, in advance prepared noodles, steamed bread and a variety of cakes, but also bought two boxes of milk and instant noodles to me. You'll have to skimp on the food you order from Jd.com, and most of all, you won't want to eat after a few home-cooked meals. One Night, I was so hungry for hot pot that the e Commerce Department couldn't deliver it, so I decided to go to the supermarket and buy it on the spot. Roommate finally convinced me. In Times of crisis, even a hot pot meal becomes extravagant. The next day, her mother came and cooked us a meal of five-color dumplings to satisfy her appetite.

Roommate's mother makes five color dumplings

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
I used to complain that I was too busy at work to practice my cooking skills. I thought I was a gourmet who was delayed by work. Now I think I might be overthinking it. A Little Miss and colleagues with a single take-out, and friends off the day of binge-eating...

And Fried everything that I could

All that's left is a fight

Sugar. 30-year-old Media Guy

My husband and I married more than a year, usually we occasionally weekend cooking, each other boast cooking skills, still have a little fun life. This outbreak, a dozen days in a row at home cooking at the same time continue to work at home, it is some collapse.

At first I fried my own meatballs under my mother's remote instruction, but now we have been reduced to buying food once every 10 days, eating two meals a day, usually one decent meal and the other mostly leftovers. Do not go on frozen dumplings, eggs fried rice, boiled instant noodles to carry two, to lose weight for not having dinner to carry a meal. And we often only cook when we're hungry, which makes us hungry by the time we're done.

Pexels

We're both in the media, and sometimes both of us have jobs that we can't get our hands on, and we're both waiting for each other to cook. But the most angry is that several times a meal he came to work, do not know is coincidence or on purpose. And after I cooked, he would say, "Don't do the dishes, I'll do them, " but at the end of each meal, the dishes were put to the next meal.

Home Office environment is also very poor, a table one person to work well, but two people sitting side by side elbow to fight, and too close to each other will affect. I ended up writing on my lap with my computer in bed, and after a few days of pain in my waist and neck, I ended up with a makeshift desk at a table that I hadn't used in a million years, and a new job on the bed before the table.

I want to go back to work, go to work, go out to dinner.

To relieve the stress of daily cat-jacking at home

It all depends on the DDL for productivity

Ko, 27, works for a PR firm

I've been working from home for five days, and when I first learned I wanted to work from home, I thought it would be great, but I may have overestimated my self-discipline. We have a regular meeting every morning, and I can pretty much guarantee that I'll be awake during the meeting. But working from home, I feel very insecure because I can't see anyone else. Working from home can be half as effective as working from home, and when you're bored or anxious and no one is talking, it's easy to brush up your voice to relieve stress.

I think one of the biggest challenges in working from home is trying not to annoy my cat, who has been attacking me every day. And work from home, buy food to eat is also a problem, since the community closed management, go out to take a pass, too troublesome. I try to buy food online, but it's almost impossible to get it every day until noon. I simply hoarded a pile of frozen dumplings and instant noodles and lived on them every day.

Pexels

Recently, the family cat food also quickly ran out of ammunition, the business said after the 10th to distribute. Recently, our cat always looked out of the window with a worried face, wondering if the shoveling officer was out of work, and there would be no more cat food in the CAN.

I feel that after working from home, communication within the company has become more efficient and the boss calls me mostly One Call Away. But when contacting a client, it is not certain. Yesterday, I had an appointment with a client for a meeting at 2:00 pm, but I didn't reply until 6:00 pm. I think it's the DDL (deadlines) that really does the most work.

This morning the company informed us to continue working from home, I feel I can do a frozen dumpling test immediately. I can't wait to go to work.

Please be nice to one side of the office

While the Cook Cooks

Ma Ning, 35, vice president of entertainment investments

We're in the business of investing in cross-regional audio and video conferences, and I'm a longtime user of many online office software, so I'm not totally unprepared for the whole "working from home" thing. But this large-scale collective work at home across the country, or let me feel some changes.

One is that everyone saves time on their commute and no one has an excuse to be late anymore. If you need to hold a meeting at any time, basically 10 minutes in advance, to give you a brief time to prepare, you can immediately enter the session.

Second, the efficiency of the meeting has been greatly improved. Unlike in the past, when we meet face to face, we exchange pleasantries, gossip, and then wait for colleagues who don't all arrive, occasionally ordering a coffee and taking out a takeaway, and now the audio and video conferences are all about getting to the point, only talking about dry goods.

Third, the value of the collaboration and online meeting tools has been maximized. Before many software people just dabbled in the most basic functions, in the absence of each other, had to work from home, now began to use some features in depth, i've found that collaborative, synchronous editing is both time saving and clear; many approvals are moved online, and it's clear where the process is going, which helps you stay focused and productive.

But there are several challenges. One is the need to consider Three Meals a Day. For example, at 11:30 this time, in the company must be focused on work, but work from home, it is necessary to consider the preparation of lunch, it is easy to blur the line between work and cooking. One time I was making soup, and I figured it would take three hours, so I put the soup on and went to a conference call. Working from home, the brain in cook mode and white-collar mode switch between, or need some challenges, so please treat at home while working, while cooking cooks.

Second, there's a lot of temptation. For example, I'm currently watching the drama "want to see you, " and when I'm working from home, I wonder if I should have seen the two new episodes last night. Fortunately, the workload at Home Office is not very saturated, can improve work efficiency, to save some time to pursue drama, reading, some of their own entertainment.

Group work is dangerous and remote work is expensive

The company is in a quandary

Feng Chen, 27, Engineer, Chip R & D Company

For US programmers, working from home is inconvenient, but during Special Times, the company decided to let us work from February 3rd for security reasons, but neither the company nor I, it's never been done before, so it's very messy and inefficient at first, maybe as little as 30%-50% of a group.

I remember very clearly that on the 3rd, our whole department didn't do any real work. The most difficult thing was to configure the environment, because to work remotely, we needed to connect to the company's computers. We were going to use a VPN connection, but some of our colleagues couldn't connect, they need to install a remote desktop software on their computer, to remotely control the company's computer, the result of our company's operation on a person, configuration is very slow.

While waiting for operation and maintenance, the leader set up several groups and simply assigned tasks, there are problems need feedback in the group, finally wait until the remote connection to the office computer, I copied some code to the local, configured the computer environment, the first day is over hastily.

Efficiency is certainly low, on the one hand, programmers need teamwork, online communication is not as efficient as group work, large companies may be better, our division of Labor is sometimes not clear, problems need to be discussed together, for example, when I meet a bug, we all look at it together. When I meet a data error, I go to a colleague's computer and look at it. These things are not easy to do. On the other hand, I do get all kinds of interruptions at home. My mother and I always chat and talk about everyday things, and I'm not in the mood to work.

The worst thing was Tuesday, I asked an intern on Wechat that day about something very important, and he didn't reply me until a day later. It was very late, and I would rush him directly to his desk if we were working in a group, there's a process that requires actual hardware, otherwise we can't go on, this chip is in the company, and I've been responsible for laying out the program to the chip, so in a hurry, I left home early to go back to Beijing, and I was on the road all day on Wednesday (February 5) , traffic Control, black car and other troubles, finally returned to Beijing, Thursday to the company took the chip, and was persuaded to return home to work.

So it's been a hectic week, the remote environment is bad, Cottonwood says. In order to ensure efficiency, our weekly newspaper has been changed to a daily newspaper. However, the work done at home is simple and the amount of work is small. Therefore, the daily newspaper is half written and half edited. I was also in charge of the daily summary of a project, we need to consolidate a few people's dailies. It's like adding to the pile.

Fortunately, this week we go to the company office, but there will be more risk, even no place to eat, which is also very troublesome, just hope that the epidemic quickly passed, otherwise really torture.

It's a lot of work

We'll wait for the kids to take a nap before we can focus

Yuki, 35, works for a company

Our company announced on February 3rd that we wouldn't have to go to the office for the whole of February, that we would go online, and that we would probably be working from home for the next few months. I'm getting used to it because I've been working online. Working from home is a state in which everyone is constantly debugging.

I actually work a lot, on the one hand to do sales business, but also to manage the team, recruitment, also do online activities. But I think the most important thing is timing.

I took care of both boys myself, and Niho, who was just over a year old, had to be fed, put to bed, bathed, and Three Meals a Day cooked, all at once consuming.

Working from home is constantly interrupted by the noise of children and late cooking times because of a long meeting. I was just explaining to the kids that it's work time, and we call it work time, not vacation time at home, and everyone has to work, so now he's reading.

Every day between 3 and 5 p.m. , when the kids fall asleep, it's a central office hour for me. Make a cup of coffee, have a conference call, and our meetings are actually very productive at this point, so we're done in about 20 minutes. We gave the Group A name called "cornering overtaking" , in the process want to quickly to grow their team to recruit excellent people.

Working Online is actually more efficient, but working offline is easier and deeper, and for communication and collaboration, it's definitely better offline. Of course, new recruits may not be able to get a good sense of the culture. Many candidates companies or the team culture, values, online office is more difficult to understand, which is one of the drawbacks.

Personally, it's true that I want to go out, but I don't particularly want to punch in at work. Work is like this, if there is something mandatory to do, not so much autonomy, very unhappy, but if there is no KPI, everything is what I want to do, can see the results feel progress, will be very positive.

Crash Strap

Eventually, you have to isolate yourself

Xiao Xi, 30, an employee of a Knowledge Service MCN institution

I've been working from home for seven days, and when I first heard about working from home, I was so excited, it was the dream job. I work in Wangjing, but I live in Tongzhou, and it takes me three or four hours to get to work. With a small child at home, I wanted to spend more time with him, so I asked my boss years ago if I could work part-time after years. But the company does not give part-time staff on insurance and Provident Fund, I am very tangled. After the epidemic came, I thought this is done, both can safely work at home, and someone to Social Security Provident Fund, two do not delay.

Our company is a knowledge services MCN organization, working from home hardly affects business, but many colleagues are now trapped in their hometown, group conference calls, we can always hear all kinds of strange voices inside, one day when the morning meeting, i heard a rooster crow.

We're not required to clock in and clock out, but we're working longer hours and getting called to work on our days off. When the meeting, the boss is also generally a word, will use the company's economic crisis to stimulate everyone's work enthusiasm. In a conference call, the boss said that the company's cash flow can last two months, can ensure that everyone's normal wages, but after two months, the company's development depends on everyone in this period of performance.

I have a 3-year-old at home who's always asking for my company. At least twenty times a day, I had to say, "mom, you play with me. " I had to tell him, "wait a minute. You play first. " . At first, he agreed to let me sit on the floor with him, and he would play by himself, and I would work on my computer, and then he wouldn't even let me touch it. Although my family is very understanding of my work, also trying to help me take care of the children, but men have limited patience to take care of the children, and soon the two of them fell out, I had to come out to mediate.

In the end, I had to isolate myself and draw a line in the sand, communicating with my family in advance what time I wanted to work, and not to be disturbed during work hours. But when a person working, and a bit can not resist the temptation of snacks, but also always want to go to bed to lie down. I think the late night office efficiency is the highest, so recently always on the night shift, black and white reversal.

Now, I miss working so much.

Dress up and work from home every day

Use video conferencing to motivate employees

Liu Xin, 32, CEO of a startup

I began to work from home on the seventh day, the tenth began to let all employees work from home. At first I was lazy, wearing pajamas and slippers every day, but then I found that there is no working state, so I dedicated a relatively independent office space at home, as his temporary office, thoroughly into working mode.

I think there's a ritual to life, a formality to getting to work, and it has nothing to do with where you work. I work from 9:30 am to 6:30 pm every day, and I have to wear a suit and make-up every morning, just like when I go to work, it makes me feel like I'm actually at work, not just goofing off. Trust me, when you spend half an hour a day at home putting on makeup, putting on a suit and high heels, you can't afford to be lazy.

My family doesn't understand why I have to wear a suit at home. I could feel my mother looking at me differently every day. And she always thought that I was going out to meet people, and would come by to "inspect" them from time to time. She pricked up her ears at the slightest movement in my room, lest I should slip out when she was not looking.

Most of my work is done on the computer, and the arrangement of the work is remote command, rarely call. The parents don't understand. They think you're just looking at the computer. One day my mother came over and asked me, "what are you doing sitting at home, looking at your computer, dressed like a waitress? "

We have a company-wide video conference every morning at 10:00 a.m. I want it to be video, not voice, because then the staff will take it seriously. Otherwise, most likely everyone is lying in bed with you in a meeting, where there is a working atmosphere? And only by video conference, I can see everyone's status, also can better control everyone's work progress.

One of the biggest problems with telecommuting is that it's hard to communicate emotions. I prefer face-to-face. There's an awkward situation in Remote Communication: My side is about to explode with anger, but the other side may not know it, and I'm so desperate to smash my phone that I can only smash my phone. If we were communicating face to face, we wouldn't have these problems.

During this time at home, I think it's because I can work and dress formally every day that I feel like I'm not a eating machine. Otherwise, it's really just dinner at home. I think a mature career woman, need to have a self-discipline of the professional spirit.

Group work is a weekday ritual

Get your life in order

Liang you, 26, founder of the plunge into the sea tavern

Since the beginning of the New Year, my girlfriend and I have been living this life: Getting up at 10 or 11 am, preparing to make lunch, eating at 2 or 3 pm, playing on my phone, chatting, preparing to make dinner, eating dinner at 7 or 8 pm, watch a movie or play a game. Go to sleep. We're on day 16 of the same life.

When I first heard about the outbreak, I was in a very low mood, because I was a shop owner and a mainline, and I was very upset about not being able to run the business.

For me, the biggest challenge of working from home is my status. Because this work from home everyone is forced, and the epidemic is so serious, it is easy to emotional overload, can not go out of their own very difficult, mental health adjustment is the biggest challenge I face. Although I also have two dogs, but for the interference of dogs and cats I feel OK, after all, many companies also have cats.

I think the main difference between working in groups and working from home is the sense of ritual. Group work may not be as efficient as working from home, but it's a work day ritual. Getting up and going to the office on time will give you a sense of routine, similar to Morita therapy. Group work is also conducive to cultivating team spirit, working from home with a sense of loss of contact with the team.

I think that working from home is even more effective than working in a group on specific, planned tasks, but there are some soft things you can't see, especially since group work can bump up a lot of new ideas and ideas that aren't part of the plan.

Right now, the biggest feeling is that I'm uncomfortable and insecure. I used to feel so far away from all kinds of accidents and disasters, but this one seems to be right around the corner. Besides, I'm a very social person, and it's really hard for me to stay at home every day. Sometimes take the opportunity to go out shopping in the morning to walk the street, people are not much, breathing every breath of air is thought to be sweet.

We can't do it offline right now, so we're GONNA do it online. The pub has 4 shopkeepers, each of whom broadcasts live for an hour a week from the beginning of the first day, making me feel connected to the outside world again. I saw that modern sky also made a bedroom music festival, these are not monetized, but they are fun.

But I think instead of focusing on the difference between working from home and working in groups, focus on what you need to do, and don't focus too much on your schedule, or you'll end up stuck in a Rut.

Work is also a social activity

Telecommuting is hard to find a sense of belonging

Mor.ai  , chief strategy officer

This period of time, not only work, in fact, the whole life at home, and usually said that at home office or a little different. Last week we did a survey of all the staff and asked them about working from home. The responses were quite interesting.

Our company is 70%-80% R & D personnel, in the questionnaire, we give the average score of 8.09(a total score of 10) , 5% of the staff think even exceed the goal.

For telecommuting tools, wechat is mostly used for communication, and nailing is used for meeting and punching in. Tencent documents and our own internal Wiki for document sharing and information.

In conclusion, the advantages of working from home were that the daily work meetings were more timely, the tasks were clear, the level of implementation was high, the non-urgent interruptions were reduced, and the continuity of the work was maintained. Internal Communication has also become more, with the cooperation of the Department of closer contact.

Of course, there are some challenges, for example, we have to test the equipment, but the testing equipment can not be shared, there is no way to reproduce many problems, online communication is still sometimes not as good as face-to-face, efficiency has been reduced, especially for the recently hired three or five new employees, it is difficult to adapt, and some financial software must go to the company's computer operation.

One thing we have to admit is that very few companies in China Telecommute, and Chinese bosses have a habit of "monitoring" what their employees are doing before they know what they are doing. When you start telecommuting all of a sudden, the boss is more anxious than the employee. Also not ready for some remote collaboration tools, the first day of work, nail and enterprise wechat have crashed, is a good proof.

If the tools aren't ready, telecommuting will be less effective. For example, nail, everyone's version is different, there will be some differences in function; for example, offline, everyone likes you to write several strokes while talking about the whiteboard, but on-line this kind of cloud throws the software which the screen collaboration very few people will go down.

Recently everyone's life is certainly relatively monotonous, in this time actually the mentality is very important. A friend of mine tells me that work feels like 007 now, all the time. There used to be other things you could do, but now you're stuck at home and there's no reason to turn down a job. But life goes on, and you need to make it more than just work, otherwise by week 3 or even month, people will go crazy.

In Chinese culture, work is also a social activity, and telecommuting makes it difficult for employees to feel a sense of belonging. There are many people who have friends from work and colleagues, and telecommuting reduces this part of the communication. So to get back to basics, the biggest challenge to telecommuting is, to some extent, not about efficiency, but about culture.

After sitting at home for half a month

I finally got to go to work today

Shen Xiaoqian, 36, Shanghai Jiangsu Chamber of Commerce

We are the Chamber of Commerce, recently all enterprises are in donations, daily information is from all over the world, I basically 24 hours to read mobile phone news.

The sad thing is, I have to do all this work in a minute, and I don't know when my little girl is going to jump on my back. She had a new trick yesterday, spilling yogurt all over my keyboard. I usually work, a week is only a little time in the evening and weekends, and now all of a sudden every day at home, she wants to play with me every day.

I have an older daughter at home, and I have to keep an eye on her, too, whether she's checking out the IPAD, chatting, or studying for the second half of the semester. Every day do Radio Calisthenics, rope skipping, dance, martial arts, piano practice, each project needs online punch card, the time schedule is full.

Every time is the family called to eat, the two small down to eat, I can have a full time to do their own thing.

It's also true that there are too many conference calls at home. If you call someone face to face, you have to call them. You may not be able to talk clearly. Some things you just say to one person may have to synchronize with another person. Especially when it comes to donations, we are all in a hurry, this New Year we are all in a break, have been calling the progress, but also a bit embarrassed.

I'm going back to work today, and I'm actually very supportive. Sitting at home for half a month "Yuezi" , now shopping malls and the streets of the atmosphere is not a bit of the New Year, really pretty depression, I think it is better to go back to work. Many chains in the market are interlinked, workers do not arrive at their posts, enterprises can not produce. You have to go out and see what's going on in the market. You can't stay home all the time.

* The title is from Pexels. Hu Qing, Tang Tang Tang, Ke Ke, Xiaoxue, Xiao Xi and Liu Xin were given pseudonyms at the request of the interviewee.

Are you looking forward to working for the company?
